Description: • Twenty-four fragments of a carved ivory cylindrical vase, some preserving a small ledge rim below which is a plain band, while the body is decorated with incised closely-spaced cross-hatching, creating a pattern of raised diamonds.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 8; pl. xxvii.2)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
